entry.title: Yekaterina Nosenko (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Igor Stravinsky said of his cousin and first wife, Yekaterina Nosenko (pictured), that they were "closer than lovers sometimes are"?

entry.title: two hoards of gold coins (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in the 1930s two hoards of gold coins were found in a cellar in Baltimore, Maryland?

entry.title: Fanya Baron (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Fanya Baron resisted her prison guards and had to be carried to the place of her execution?

entry.title: Misfits and Magic (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the creators of Misfits and Magic said that they sympathize with those who choose not to watch it?

entry.title: John Hitchman (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after the death of surgeon and philanthropist John Hitchman the townspeople of Leamington Spa, England, erected a fountain in his memory?

entry.title: Kasama (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Chicago's Kasama is the world's first Filipino restaurant to be awarded a Michelin star?

entry.title: Barbara L. Drinkwater (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that before becoming the first woman president of the American College of Sports Medicine, Barbara L. Drinkwater had an undefeated season as a women's college basketball coach?

entry.title: Peta (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that by 1967, staff at the Home Office were told not to feed Peta morsels of food as she had become "inordinately fat"?
